attributes.action: stop using Primary Schools as Polling stations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is grossly unfair that Primary schools are used as Polling stations.

Firstly it means that our children will only receive 194 days of education, whereas children from other schools will receive the full 195 that they are entitled to.

The second and main problem is the cost implication that this has for parents. 

In most families both parents are working. One parent will have to take the day off work, on top of the fact that the children have teacher training days.

There are no childcare facilities available for Polling day or teacher training as they only run during the school holidays.

I feel very strongly that, if schools are to be used as a polling station in future, that the Council should make free childcare available to the parents by using a leisure centre, or other suitable location such as a local college or secondary school.

I feel that the current situation is grossly unfair and only adversely affects parents with children attending schools used as polling stations.
